newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish exports guarantee body to boost capital.
newsitem.headline: Polish exports guarantee body to boost capital.

text.p: Poland's state-controlled Credit Exports Insurance Corporation (KUKE) will increase its share capital by some 60 percent to up to 84.7 million zlotys, to provide more export credit guarantees, PAP news agency said.
PAP said the decision was made at KUKE's general shareholders meeting on Thursday.
PAP quoted KUKE president Krzysztof Jasinski as saying that the new capital would come from the firm's current shareholders in proportion to their stakes held so far.

KUKE shareholders include the finance ministry, the economy ministry, the central bank, state-owned Bank Handlowy SA, Bank Rozowju Eksportu SA, insurer Warta and other banks and trading companies. -- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
